meanings.definition: A system in medieval Europe in which land was divided into manors and peasants worked the land for a lord.
meanings.sent1: In manorialism, peasants lived on the lord's land and worked for him.
meanings.sent2: The manorialism of medieval times involved peasants tending to the fields of the lord.
meanings.sent3: The manorialism arrangement sometimes led to interesting relationships between lords and peasants.
meanings.sent4: Manorialism can be seen as a structured dance between the lord and the peasants.
meanings.sent5: The concept of manorialism paints a picture of a tightly knit community on the manor.
